title: The 'spam' emails that could save a woman's life
text:
For many women, a major obstacle to seeking help or information is the fear of being caught by an abusive partner. The answer? An email no one could possibly suspect...

“Top 10 uses for charcoal” may sound like your average clickbait, but for a victim of domestic violence these words could be a lifeline.

Communication in the digital age is easier than ever. For most, this means new freedom, but for women in abusive relationships, this means increased surveillance and limited privacy.

Domestic violence related deaths in the UK have reached a five-year high, and MP Jess Phillips has warned that police lack the resources to cope. To connect these women to the help they need, charities like Chayn...
